cdetidy 0.1.4
  • Reference

Validate a joined vs. distinct dataset and return the deduplicated frame

validate_combined_data.Rd

Creates a fully distinct version of a *joined* dataset (across all columns), verifies that every ID (optionally by year) present in the joined data also appears in the distinct data, and (optionally) checks that the supplied key columns form a primary key on the distinct data.

Usage

validate_combined_data(
  data,
  key_cols,
  check_pk = TRUE,
  include_year = TRUE,
  id_cols = c("cds", "district_code", "school_code"),
  show_examples = 10,
  ...
)

Arguments

data

A data frame that represents the **joined** data (may contain duplicates).

key_cols

Character vector of columns that should uniquely identify rows in the *distinct* data (e.g., `c("cds","year")`, `c("district_code","year")`).

check_pk

Logical; if `TRUE` (default), run [validate_primary_key()] on the distinct data and report the result. Extra arguments are forwarded via `...`.

include_year

Logical; when `TRUE` (default) and a column named `"year"` exists in both data frames, coverage checks use `(id, year)` pairs; otherwise they use the ID alone.

id_cols

Character vector of ID columns to audit for coverage. Defaults to `c("cds","district_code","school_code")`. Only IDs that are actually present in `data` are checked.

show_examples

Integer; how many example missing keys to print if any joined keys are not found in the distinct data. Default `10`.

...

Additional arguments passed to [validate_primary_key()] (e.g., `sample_n`, `full_run`, `seed`).

Value

The **distinct** data frame (`dplyr::distinct(data)`), invisibly printing coverage and (optionally) primary-key validation messages.

Details

This is meant for annualized “combined” dims where multiple files/years are row-bound first, then deduplicated into a single canonical table. Informative messages are printed with **cli**.

- Coverage check: for each ID in `id_cols` that exists in `data`, confirms that all `(id[, year])` keys from the joined data also appear in the distinct data; prints examples if not. - Primary-key check: if `check_pk = TRUE`, calls [validate_primary_key(distinct_df, key_cols, ...)] and reports success/failure.

See also

[validate_primary_key()]

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Districts example
districts_distinct <- validate_combined_data(
  data = assessment_districts_joined,
  key_cols = c("district_code", "year"),
  full_run = TRUE
)

# Schools example (sample PK check for speed)
schools_distinct <- validate_combined_data(
  data = assessment_schools_joined,
  key_cols = c("school_code", "year"),
  sample_n = 10000, full_run = FALSE
)
} # }
